questions.question: What do version vowels indicate in Georgian verbs?

options.text: Whose benefit or perspective the action is for

questions.explanation: Version vowels indicate whose benefit or perspective the action is for - subjective (for oneself) or objective (for others).

questions.question: What does the subjective version ი- [i-] mean?
questions.explanation: The subjective version ი- [i-] indicates the action is for the subject's own benefit - 'for myself.'

questions.question: What does the objective version უ- [u-] mean?
questions.explanation: The objective version უ- [u-] indicates the action is for someone else's benefit - 'for others.'

questions.question: Match the verb forms to their correct version types:
questions.explanation: ვიწერ uses ი- subjective, ვუწერ uses უ- objective, ვწერ has no version (neutral).

questions.question: ვდაიწერ [vdaints'er] means:

options.text: I will write for myself (perfective + subjective)

questions.explanation: ვდაიწერ combines: ვ- [v-] 'I' + და- [da-] perfective + ი- [i-] subjective = 'I will write for myself.'

questions.question: ვდაუწერ [vdauts'er] means:

options.text: I will write for someone (perfective + objective)

questions.explanation: ვდაუწერ combines: ვ- [v-] 'I' + და- [da-] perfective + უ- [u-] objective = 'I will write for someone.'

questions.question: ვიყიდულობ წიგნს [viqidulob ts'igns] - What does ი- [i-] indicate here?

options.text: I am buying the book for someone else
I am buying the book for myself

questions.explanation: ვიყიდულობ [viqidulob] uses subjective version ი- [i-], meaning 'I am buying the book for myself.'

questions.question: ვუყიდულობ წიგნს [vuqidulob ts'igns] - What does უ- [u-] indicate here?

options.text: I am buying the book for myself
I am buying the book for someone else

questions.explanation: ვუყიდულობ [vuqidulob] uses objective version უ- [u-], meaning 'I am buying the book for someone else.'
